title: At what distance above the Earth's surface is the acceleration due to gravity less by 10% of its value at the surface? - Quora

response.answer_text: First let’s list what we know: The formula for gravitational acceleration is g=GMR2g=GMR2 The gravitational acceleration on Earth’s surface is approximately 9.81m/s29.81m/s2. The mass of the Earth: 5.972×1024kg5.972×1024kg The universal gravitational constant: 6.67408×10−11m3kg−1s−26.67408×10−11m3kg−1s−2 The radius of the Earth: 6.378×106m6.378×106m Since we’re looking for distance, we want to rearrange the equation so that RR is alone on one side of the equation. So: gR2=GMgR2=GM R2=GMgR2=GMg R=GMg−−−−√R=GMg Finding 10% less of something is the same as finding 90% of that something, so we find our goal acceleration with 0.9×9.810.9×9.81 which equals 8.83m/s28.83m/s2. Now we plug in our values to find RR: R=6.67408×10−11×5.972×10248.83−−−−−−−−−−−−−−−−−−−−−−−−−−√R=6.67408×10−11×5.972×10248.83 R=6.72×106mR=6.72×106m Now, note that this is the distance from the point where gravitational acceleration is 8.83 to the center of the Earth. We’re looking for the distance to the surface of the Earth, so we’re going to have to subtract the radius: 6.72×106−6.378×106=3.42×105m6.72×106−6.378×106=3.42×105m or 342km342km There’s your answer.

As this decreases by the square of the distance, then to have a 10% reduction means you have to be 5% further from the centre of the earth (as the square root of 1.1 is about 1.05). The radius of the earth is about 6,400 kms; 5% of this is 320 kms, so you have to be about 320 kms above the surface of the earth - the height of a low earth orbit.

Since a=GM/(r^2), solving for r=sqft(GM/a). Since G and M are constants (close enough, anyway) then r is proportional to the square root of 1/a. Your given value for a In 0.9, so, we need to find the square root of 1.11111… then multiply that times the radius of the Earth and subtract the radius to get your altitude. Sqft(1.11111…) is 1.0541, multiply that by the average radius of the Earth, 3959mi, results in r=4173mi. This, your altitude is 214mi.
You have to fly up, to a height of about 350 km. Commercial planes fligh at a height of about 10 km while ISS is orbiting earth at a height of about 400 km.
